title: `[aria-*]` attributes do not match their roles
description: Each ARIA `role` supports a specific subset of `aria-*` attributes. Mismatching these invalidates the `aria-*` attributes. [Learn how to match ARIA attributes to their roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-attr).

node.snippet: <span target="_self" class="active dropdown-toggle nav-link-" data-bs-toggle="dropdown" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="true">
node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-expanded="false"

title: Uses ARIA roles on incompatible elements
description: Many HTML elements can only be assigned certain ARIA roles. Using ARIA roles where they are not allowed can interfere with the accessibility of the web page. [Learn more about ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-allowed-role).

node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  ARIA role button is not allowed for given element

title: Elements use prohibited ARIA attributes
description: Using ARIA attributes in roles where they are prohibited can mean that important information is not communicated to users of assistive technologies. [Learn more about prohibited ARIA roles](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/aria-prohibited-attr).

node.snippet: <a id="top" data-uw-rm-kbnav="anohref" tabindex="0" aria-label="Open this option" data-uw-rm-empty-ctrl="">
node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  aria-label attribute cannot be used on a a with no valid role attribute.

node.snippet: <a id="main-content" data-uw-rm-kbnav="anohref" tabindex="0" aria-label="Open this option" data-uw-rm-empty-ctrl="">
node.explanation:
Fix all of the following:
  aria-label attribute cannot be used on a a with no valid role attribute.

title: Links rely on color to be distinguishable.
description: Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read. Link text that is discernible improves the experience for users with low vision. [Learn how to make links distinguishable](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/link-in-text-block).

node.snippet: <a href="https://www.njc.edu/node/2027" aria-label="Cancellation must be initiated by either filling out a written request to …" data-uw-rm-vglnk="" uw-rm-vague-link-id="https://www.njc.edu/node/2027$here" data-uw-rm-brl="PR" data-uw-original-href="https://www.njc.edu/node/2027">
node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  The link has insufficient color contrast of 2.85:1 with the surrounding text. (Minimum contrast is 3:1, link text: #4d2de8, surrounding text: #000000)
  The link has no styling (such as underline) to distinguish it from the surrounding text

relatedNode.nodeLabel: Cancellation must be initiated by either filling out a written request to the D…

title: Elements with visible text labels do not have matching accessible names.
description: Visible text labels that do not match the accessible name can result in a confusing experience for screen reader users. [Learn more about accessible names](https://dequeuniversity.com/rules/axe/4.10/label-content-name-mismatch).

node.snippet: <a href="mailto:kelli.moe@njc.ed" aria-label="send an email to kelli.moe@njc.ed" data-uw-rm-vglnk="" uw-rm-vague-link-id="mailto:kelli.moe@njc.ed$send an email to kelli.moe@njc.ed">
node.explanation:
Fix any of the following:
  Text inside the element is not included in the accessible name
